  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer arrived to 042 and when it was opened, it was discovered that a 1000 lbs pallet was placed on a pallet containing 2 5 gallon buckets of adhesives. The buckets were crushed. One bucket lost half of it's contents, the other lost roughly a quarter of its contents. The spill had dried and was co ntained to the pallet.

item.title: Report X-2024121056
item.description:
Report X-2024121056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIRTEEN AIR PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND PACKAGED IN THERMO CHILL POLAR TECH INDUSTRIES PACKAGING. THE BOXES ARE PREPRINTED RUSH, PERISHABLE, INSULATED, WITH ORIENTATION UP ARROWS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT IN EACH BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z4JT33N1331437381, 1Z4JT33N1332571993, 1Z4JT33N0114238347, 1Z4JT33N1318936143, 1Z4JT33N1316815125, 1Z4JT33N0100667561, 1Z4JT33N1305722559, 1Z4JT33N0111554715, 1Z4JT33N1330981160, 1Z4JT33N1306912333, 1Z4JT33N0128820431 AND 1Z4JT33N0132370651. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4JT33N, COLLIN HILL, 300 SCOTTDALE AVE., SCOTTDALE PA 15683-1240.

item.title: Report E-2024120323
item.description:
Report E-2024120323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At Veolia's ten-day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA, an incident occurred involving a 5-gallon container of sodium hydroxide solution. While being transferred to a pallet on the loading dock, it was discovered that the container's cap had not been properly secured. Consequently, a small amount of sodium hydroxide, less than a pint, leaked onto the concrete surface of the loading dock. Immediate action was taken to address the spill. Specialized spill cleanup material was used to solidify the leaked sodium hydroxide. Following safety protocols, both the original container and the used cleanup material were carefully overpacked into a larger 30-gallon drum for proper containment and disposal. After the initial response, the cap on the 5-gallon container was properly tightened to prevent further leakage. As a precautionary measure, the rest of the load was thoroughly inspected to ensure all other containers were secured properly. It was determined that all other caps were secure, and this particular container had been the only one overlooked during the initial preparation.

item.title: Report E-2024120258
item.description:
Report E-2024120258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCA experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate released from a 50 pound paper bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25 ounces of product released to a 20’ x 2’ trail from the metal trailer floor onto the concrete dock. The damaged bag was collected and all released material swept up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024120256
item.description:
Report E-2024120256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RR SHOP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3030
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 19th at 1715 hrs, personnel in the Buffalo & Pittsburgh Railroad's Butler Yard discovered tank car CBTX721497, a loaded tank car of Hydrocarbons, Liquid, NOS leaking from top fittings' protective housing cover. BPRR management promptly implemented their emergency response plan and isolated the rail car. The shipper, MPLX on behalf of Foster Gas was notified via CHEMTREC's report number 2024-11-20-00093. Additionally, the National Response Center (report# 1416851) was contacted regarding the release of product. Shawn Dunkle, MPLX Operations Supervisor, responded and discovered that the liquid line was partially open and the secondary closure camlock cap gasket was missing. Mr. Dunkle closed the liquid line valve and installed a new cam lock cap gasket to secure the container. To ensure the railcar's service equipment was working as designed, MPLX requested a post load securement test be performed. Specialized Professional Services (SPSI) pressured up the container to 15psi and found that the liquid line valve was defective (ball valve bypass). On 12/11/2024, SPSI performed a product transfer into tank car CBTX721426. The car owner, CIT Group is in the process of making arrangements to replace the defective liquid line valve. Non-Accident Report Index (NARRI); 5(5+5+0) x (2+0) = 100 NARRI; Non-Accident Release Code 300 (Liquid Line Valve Body - Other)

item.title: Report E-2024120283
item.description:
Report E-2024120283

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-17
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RR SHOP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10215
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Empty LPG UN1075 residue car (GATX21086) was heard hissing and smelling of propane. SPSI was contacted and mobilized, arriving at 1230 hrs. SPSI met with Mechanical Manager Clinton Simons to obtain track protection for CN Runner track (616) via blue flag, brake set, switches locked. After safety briefing, SPSI crew climbed to top of car with MX4 to assess for leaks and applied Snoop around the PRD. It was determined the PRD was leaking. Crew used Indian Spring capping kit (64A) to cap off the PRD. Snoop was reapplied to verify there were no leaks present, waited 25 minutes before checking it again. No leaks were verified on the PRD. Clinton Simons was notified of findings, general housekeeping was performed of work area, and crew demobilized back to shop.
